body_html:
@mrry worked for by adding the --ignore-installed numpy, but then when I try to run the test example (https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.11/get_started/os_setup.html#test-the-tensorflow-installation) and try to import the tf library I get this

RuntimeError: module compiled against API version 0xa but this version of numpy is 0x9

Which is indeed what was done adding the --ignore option, ignoring the existing numpy version? I'm completely new to python, so you'll have to excuse any straight forward problems I can't see :).
body:
@mrry worked for by adding the --ignore-installed numpy, but then when I try to run the test example (https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.11/get_started/os_setup.html#test-the-tensorflow-installation) and try to import the tf library I get this

```
RuntimeError: module compiled against API version 0xa but this version of numpy is 0x9
```

Which is indeed what was done adding the --ignore option, ignoring the existing numpy version? I'm completely new to python, so you'll have to excuse any straight forward problems I can't see :).
